metadata.Title: CVE-2021-43400 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in gatt-database.c in BlueZ 5.61. A use-after-free can occur when a client disconnects during D-Bus processing of a WriteValue call.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-43400` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bluetooth - 5.53-0ubuntu3.4
bluez - 5.53-0ubuntu3.4
bluez-cups - 5.53-0ubuntu3.4
bluez-hcidump - 5.53-0ubuntu3.4
bluez-obexd - 5.53-0ubuntu3.4
bluez-tests - 5.53-0ubuntu3.4
libbluetooth3 - 5.53-0ubuntu3.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bluez package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.53-0ubuntu3.4').
